pr_title: GH-1484: Compatibility serialization for RDF* in RDF and RDF* serialization for tuple query results

timeline.bodyText: Could we add the functionality to the existing sparql-json module, instead of introducing a new module? Same for the text one.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: Sure, what about turtlestar and trigstag then? I'd be happy to add those to turtle and trig as well instead of having them as separate modules.
replies.author: avataar

replies.bodyText: Good point. Yes, if you can. I think the functionality is closely enough related that it makes more sense to have this in the same module. Plus we're already a bit module-heavy in RDF4J, I'd rather avoid creating even more unless we have to.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.message:
GH-1484: RDF* serialization for Binary query results (extended existing format) and two new formats, SPARQL* JSON and SPARQL* TSV

GH-1484: RDF* compatibility serialization (as IRIs) for all RDF formats

GH-1484: Added another MIME type for Turtle* to better reflect its Turtle origin

GH-1484: Parser/writer (both RDF and query result) cleanup and contract enforcement, improved tests

GH-1484: NTriplesUtil moved outside NTriples module (similar to some other NTriples related classes used in multiple places)
Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>

GH-1484: Moved Turtle* and TriG* to Turtle and TriG modules instead of separate modules

Signed-off-by: Pavel Mihaylov <pavel@ontotext.com>
